name: Coqui Inn

reviews.title: Frightening
reviews.text: I booked 2 rooms at Casa Mathiesen in San Juan for nights in March of 2003. I had been looking for a relatively cheap hotel and I definitely found it. I have stayed at many hotels all over the world and never been as disappointed as I was with Casa Mathiesen. They have phones in the rooms, but you have to leave a deposit at the front desk (which is a block away at the Green Isle Inn) in order to call even the front desk!! The photos on their web-site are nice, but they were not taken at this hotel, at least not in the past 30 years. My bathroom had a "shower" in the corner with no curtain or even any sort of ridge to contain the water. I could be taking a shower and pee into the toilet at the same time. By the time I was done with my shower, the entire bathroom was drenched. I was there for 2 days and never found the promised second pool. . .perhaps it was in the middle of the cemetary next door. Please don't be fooled by the apparent low cost, the lesson in Puerto Rico is that you get what you pay for. Good luck.

reviews.title: I see what's going on here
reviews.text: I gave the Mango Inn a neutral rating, because I haven't been there yet, but have a reservation. I read the reviews and see what's going on. As some reviewers pointed out, if you pay the lowest price, you don't expect the highest quality. I've stayed at a place in Ensenada with no toilet paper or soap. I chose it because in was the cheapest. If I wanted toilet paper, I should have stayed at the place next door and paid $5 more. I've stayed at the Downtown L.A. Bilmore. Got tired of 20 staffers standing around with their hands folded, saying, "Good Morning, Sir." I'm going to do what I've done before. In fact, once I stayed at some gay hotel in Condado, paid the "gay premium," and was up all night, because the thumping of the bass in the disco below prevented us from getting any sleep. In the morning we moved across the street, paid even less, no gay premium, and were quite comfortable among the straight clientele. It's not really a good example, because we went from more expensive to cheaper, but it's an illustration that, unless you do something stupid like prepay the whole stay, you can move. And being there, you can check out some other places in a cluster of hotels like in Condado Beach and Isla Verde. Here's what we're gonna do. By the way, I'm with the same great guy with whom I went to Condado in 1980. San Juan is our honeymoon and second honeymoon choice. We're gonna go to The Mango. Pay for one night. I'm less likely to hate it than the other beer price/champagne taste guests. I know what to expect. It's what I chose. If I decide to pay more, from what I see PLENTY more, we'll spend a couple hours checking out some other places the next morning, and move, probably paying two or three times as much. Since we've got a rental car and will be out all day, maybe we'll be satisfied to sleep there. In our early days we had a tiny apartment, and our parents slept on a wall bed in the living room. We're flexible, not hard to please. If there's no toilet paper, we'll ask for it the Mango Inn. The charm is that you can always move. If you want the cheapest place, that's the Mango Inn, and that's where we'll stay, at least for starters.

reviews.title: A horrible shack... don't waste your money!!!!
reviews.text: My boyfriend and I went there for the first time and it is the most horrible thing on earth. Before we were even dropped off the taxi driver told us the area is very very dangerous at night. He said there were drugs and shootings there at night. He advised us to go to another tourist resort like the Ritz or Marriott. We actually arrived and went back home the same day because this place looked like a five year old built it. Very dark and looked like a pawn shop. There is graffitti all around the neighborhood. I highly do not recommend it. Pay the extra few bucks to stay at a real hotel. I have to go back there again and erase this out of my memory. The photo of the room looked nice online but there were no photos of the outside because it looked like the ghetto. Really !!! DO NOT GO THERE!!

reviews.title: A nightmare
reviews.text: A nightmare. Bad neighborhood. The room wasn't a room but almost a brooms closet, right there in the lobby. Staff rude and unfriendly. We left the second day, because they didn;t have water, and when it came back next day, they didn't have hot water. We came back from the beach and we couldn't take a shower, and when I went to ask what happened. the man there wouldn't even look at me, he dismissed me saying "they are fixing it". They wouldn't tell the arriving new guests about this. They told us they would give us back the money for the 2 nights we didn't spend, since in that moment the computer was down. 10 days later and no refund yet, nor answer to my messages. DON'T GO

I end up in this hotel in April 2006, when attending a conference in San Juan, because all other hotels were full. My advice is: If this is the only hotel with available rooms that you can find in the whole Puerto Rico, then simply look for another destination in the Caribbean or just stay home. This place is horrible. The "breakfast" is rubbish, the rooms are dirty and dark, showers are like those you would expect in a prison, the building is dismal and lacks any amenities (except a swimming pool that is more like a bathtub), if your neighbors are just a little noise, prepare for a sleepless night, because the walls are like paper. The location is terrible. An appalling experience. For the same price you can get a much better hotel elsewhere in the United States or the Caribbean.
reviews.title: Worst hotel I have ever slept in

reviews.text: This year I booked three rooms at the Coqui Inn for a one-night stay prior to a cruise leaving from Puerto Rico. The rooms were for my wife and myself, my daughter, her husband, their two small children and my mother-in-law, and my brother.
reviews.title: Would never consider staying at the Coqui Inn again

likes.disliked: — Lack of upkeep and lack of cleanliness.

reviews.text: For such a one-night stay I just wanted something basic, clean, economical and comfortable. We selected the Coqui based on the reviews I read on this web site, and the 3 out of 5 average it received. I think this is a point or two higher than it should be.
reviews.title: Expected better

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Our impression was the general lack of upkeep and cleanliness. The rooms were nothing like anything you would consider modern (think Best Western, Red Roof Inn or Holiday Inn). We were very reticent to put our bare feet on the floors. We had a kitchenette in our room that we wouldn’t even think of using. We were very disappointed with the overall appearance and condition of the Coqui.
reviews.title: A modest inn
Home away from home
reviews.text: There was a dead roach or something on the bathroom floor, and a few insects flying around in the room. We awakened in the morning with some mosquito bites.

reviews.title: Nice place
reviews.text: It was a nice place to stay. The bathroom needed cleaning, but hey! I did it. You can't ask for a 5 star hotel service. It was a confortable room and I enjoyed it.

reviews.title: Sketchy
reviews.text: We went there and checked out asap... it is a bad neibourhood...perhaps acceptable if you go in large groups but otherwise... nah

reviews.title: Not bad at all
reviews.text: After reading some bad reviews I thought this place was going to be a a bit grubby, but its actually quite nice, clean, near the beach and the room was cleaned every morning. We had two tvs, kitchen, AC and lots of space...the only negative thing id say was that the shower was a but weak, but apart form that, its great value.

reviews.title: Do Not Go!
reviews.text: Do not let the price of this (Hotel?) fool you. Upon buying and confirming our reservations via a Hotel search sight, and also confirming our two rooms directly with the Hotel, we were the losers. We had a confirmed late arrival because our flight got in around midnight. After spending $40.00 between two families for our Cab ride there we were told they had no rooms for us, dispite the fact that they had charged our Credit Card for the two rooms that very day. As a result our two families (including 4 children and 20 pieces of luggage for a cruise) were literaly walking very dangerous streets looking for rooms. Eventually we did find a Hotel available at well more than twice the Green Isle Inns rate at about 3 o-clock in the morning. This Hotel SO BLATANTLY MISREPRESENTED itself and was absolutly no help in rectifing it's problem that I am in the proccess of taking legal action!

reviews.title: a cute place
reviews.text: I was just there last week on Spring Break, even though I only stayed for one night, I thought it was pretty nice. We booked for only 1 double bed but got 2- we weren't complaining. The bathroom was small, and the water pressure was not great, but it was clean. The bed squeked but still comfy. The AC was good, the pool is small but at least they have one. It was pretty quiet and the neighborhood was not bad. It was close to everything. After one night, we stayed at Hotel Del Central and even though the room was nicer, it was in the 4th floor OF A HOSPITAL! Now, I wanted to go back to Mango Inn. Don't ever stay here, they dont even inform you that its in the hospital. So yeah, Mango Inn gets a thumbs up. Besides, it was cheap.

reviews.title: Left after 1 night
reviews.text: I lasted one night - the room was tiny, barely lit, musty and just unbearable. Traveling on a student budget I didn't want to splurge too much and thought Mango would be decent - I ended up at the Green Isle inn next door which was MUCH better and only a few bucks cheaper

The Inn is located not far from the airport, which is great. The room was spacious enough, but the bathroom, although roomy, could use some fixing of the tub faucets. The pool is very nice and warm (unfortunately too warm for the kind of heat at the time of our stay). Great Internet service access is provided. Just wish the owner would stick with one name, as looking for "El Coqui" seemed kind of difficult. Other names for the place are "Mathiesen House" and some other name I can't recall. Parking is available, not inside the premises, but just outside.
reviews.title: Great Pool
If you realy want to know Puerto Rico at it best, this is the place to be
reviews.text: This is the best place to stay in Puerto Rico, good personal service, clean, efficient, safe, ...everithing you are looking for, and more. If coming to Puerto Rico, there is no need to go enywhere else, I guarantee it.

reviews.title: nice place
reviews.text: I was at The Mango for a week an it is a charming little place, with very nice people and cozy. Very close to the beach and to restaurants. Close to everything you need on vacation without the big price.

reviews.title: This Hotel Is Not Recommened If You Looking For A Good Vacation
reviews.text: I was here on April 06 and my Partner and I could not believe what we have seen. I had made reservation and planned to stay for the whole weekon April 23,06 to April 30,06 My friend refer me the the website and it look very nice and attractive for a good price I was looking for. When we got there aftermidnight on april 24,06 the reception sent us to un-attractive room. The room had a weird smell, the bed was nasty it looked like someone has sex before we came, the room was full of dust and the kitchen and batrrom looked horrible. The worse part is the key that the reception guy given to did not work with the door to lock our self making both of feel worry and insecure. We complain to the guy and he put us to antoher room a bit bigger for the night. The next morning I checked out and was charged full- Price. This Hotel is Horrible for a Gay Couple like us looking for an attractive hotel near a beach to spent with each other. I recommened Alantic beach Hotel which is very attractive near the beach and way better service for the same price.

reviews.title: Avoid this hotel - awful experience
reviews.text: My husband found this place in a guide book. And based on the other two previous reviews on this hotel on Tripadvisor, we thought that for the price it would work for just a one night stay. I was very disappointed. First of all, the hotel is next to a very busy freeway and is one block away from a cemetery (I wish someone would have mentioned that to me). The room smells like mildew and smoke, there were stains on the walls and carpet. The bathroom was dirty with peeling paint on the tub and wall. And let me just say that I've seen cleaner public toilet than the one in the room. We had to stay out all night in Old San Juan so we didn't have to sleep in the room too long. But once we actually tried to sleep we couldn't because the walls are so thin we could here people's loud conversation next door. I'm generally not a very picky person and have slept in pitched-tent in the jungle for days (with no toilets). But for the $80 we spent ($60 + $20 tax) it was NOT a great deal. I've seen better hostels in third-world countries. Fair warning...

My husband and I stayed here in late November (right before Thanksgiving) because we were going on a cruise. We didn't want to spend a lot on a hotel for one night, so chose here. The price was nice, the room a little shabby. We found a few weeks later that we brought home bed bugs! I honestly don't know if it was from the hotel or cruise ship, but before you stay, check the mattress. Don't bring your luggage into your home. Wrap it in a plastic garbage bag, fumigate with bug spray and let it sit for a few weeks. Wash everything in very hot water before you put your clothes back!
reviews.title: Bed Bugs
Great Place for the money...
reviews.text: I Stayed at the Coqui Inn in April 2006 and the truth was I was by myself and for 74 dollars a night I expected a hole in the wall. Well to my surprise I got a room with two double beds and and small kitchen with a working frig and stove. The bathroom needed an upgrade but everything worked and at night it gets alittle noisy but coming from a City that didn't bother me at all. The pool was great and the internet worked great. There are some great stores nearby. You can park right outside of the motel area and the beach is a walking distance. There is a supermarket nearby also .For the money it was great. I would use their service again . Took some pics hope they help. There is also a resturant and pool on the permises.

reviews.title: Not what I expected
reviews.text: I stay in this hotel on june 1st, 2006. I made the reservations in january, we were five guests and needed a room for five guests, that's why we choose this hotel. For our surprise when we arrived, there where only two beds (when we expecifically asked for a room for five guests). They try to resolved the matter by gaving us a bed that was storage .... Storaged .... On a little outdoor room, so i will never know if that bed was some other cat's bed, because there where a lot of cats hanging around.

My best friend and I stayed at the Mango Inn over Memorial Day weekend. I had read the other reviews before travelling and was a little nervous. After staying there, it wasn't bad at all. It was clean and rodent/pest free. The staff were very friendly and helpful. If you are on a budget then the Mango Inn is an option. My only complaints are that they do not supply guests with washcloths, so we had to walk to Walgreens and purchase some; and there was a sitting area outside our door, which some loud guests enjoyed sititng at every morning, which ruined my sleeping until 10am. The only reason I would not stay there again, is because I'm lazy and didn't like walking up the stairs and across the walkway to get to the beach and walking back after a night of partying in heels. Overall, it served it's purpose- to catch a few zzz's and allow us to get showered and dressed.
reviews.title: A true story
Happy as a Coqui
reviews.text: My husband and I are frequent travelers and hotel customers. We have high standards of what we want in a hotel and location for us is a big part of it. We stayed in a double. We were pleasently surprised by the size of the room. Huge! Very clean and excellent a/c. Pool was immaculate, cleaned every morning( I watched while tanning.) Housekeeping was how I like it, they were available but they didn't chase you out of your room. I had no problem getting clean towels or linen changed. Laundry was easily done. Kitchenette was great. Very accessible to beach, restaurants and a wonderful bakery around the corner. Desk was open 24hrs and all my questions were answered. I would recommend the "Coqui" to any of my family and friends.

Although I have stayed at this hotel in the past, my last visit was truly horrible!!! To begin with they did not have a record of our reservation. To make things worse I actually found a used condom wrapper in my bed sheets. We found the condom on our second night due to the fact that on the first night we were so exhausted we fell asleep on top of the bed without turning the covers down. In spite of this, I tried to gracious keeping in mind the nice experience we had at this hotel in 2005. However, If this wasn’t bad enough, I soon started to suffer from massive bug bites which at first I assumed to be mosquitoes. Much to my disgust and dismay I soon learned that it was not mosquitoes that were feeding on my body but BEDBUGS!!! After a long discussion with the management, they finally agreed to change our room. They didn’t even have the decency to comp us for the three nights we spent sleeping with the bedbugs and condom wrapper. Unfortunately, I did not make an issue of this or demand to be comped for the room in spite of the fact that friends that I called in the states suggested that I should demand to be comped and that I should report the to the Puerto Rican Tourism Board ( which I was also gracious enough not to do). I must say that I left more than my heart in old San Juan as a courtesy of the bedbugs I’m sure I also left a couple of pounds of my flesh. That and over sixty bucks that I had to spend on bug spray anti itch creams etc.
reviews.title: Coqui Inn AKA Bedbug Inn

likes.disliked: — the bedbugs and the condom wrapper in my bed

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In conclusion, I had to personally fumigate the room in which my nephew and I were staying. After which, I did not want the hotel to clean my room but unfortunately there wasn’t a do not disturb sign that we could use to indicate that we didn’t want them cleaning the room and possibly exposing us to further contamination of bedbugs. I came away from this trip totally disgusted with the quality of service at this hotel. Unfortunately, I also came away disillusioned about visiting my homeland in the near future as well. I most say that I have always preferred to spend my vacations and money in my own homeland however, after this visit; I must seriously consider spending my money and vacation in other locations.
reviews.title: Would never go back there again
This was a great place with great staff!
reviews.text: The Coqui Inn AKA The Bedbug Inn

I booked this hotel in Isla Verde area of San Juan, Puerto Rico because of the low rates they had compared to the other area hotels. But I was totally disgusted when I saw this place and I had to pay more than 80.00 US dollars for a night there. This "cheap hotel" should not be anything more than 35 dollars in the US. I arrived at the hotel in the evening and as soon as I walked in I was disgusted and wanted to walk right back out. But unfortunately we had two large suitcases and a carryon with us and didn't know the area too well and we were there in San Juan for the first time. The taxi had already left as well. I asked the man in the front desk if I could see the room that was assigned to us and he gave us the key to the room. We had initially planned to stay there for 5 nights. We had to walk around the swimming pool (where all the people were staring us at as if were some aliens or something) to the room through a dark corridor area. Our room was all the way at the end and it was right next to the busy highway at the street level. The door handle was broken and the screws were out from the door handle and it looked like someone tried to break into the room. The deadbolt was functional but I wouldn't trust it! The room was big with two beds. The fridge was not working with some kind of stinch coming from it. The A/C was working good. The bathroom was disgusting with some stains in the shower area which looked like blood stains. We went back to the front desk and told the guy there that the room lock was broken and he said they can only get it fixed the next day. We still needed a place to stay for the night and we booked the room for that night, because we had no other choice as we were new to the place and was there for the first time in San Juan. We went to the room and kept our luggages in the room and went outside to take a walk. There is a bridge right outside of this motel to cross the highway to the Isla Verde Ave on the other side and to the Isla Verde beach. We went over to the other side and saw this Howard Johnson Hotel there and the manager was so nice to accomodate us there in a Suite for a few more bucks than what we were supposed to pay at this cheap motel. We stayed for the next 5 nights at the HoJo and had a great time in San Juan. The HoJo suite was a million times better than the room in Coqui Inn, and we didn't mind paying a few more dollars for our safety and can sleep rest assured. We would never go back to this Coqui Inn ever again. Please don't be fooled by the pictures & descriptions on their website because they are deceiving. We went back into Coqui Inn and checked out from there within 1 hour of our check in there. The man at the front desk was not too happy but he was kind enough to refund our payment in full for the night.
reviews.title: Worst Hotel Ever!!

reviews.text: I arrived at the Coqui Inn or as it is known, The Green Isle on August 6. I was here for ten days. After reading reviews from other people who had stayed here, I was ready for the worst. However, I had a great time.
reviews.title: Wet holiday at the coqui

description: The Coqui-Inn is a great choice for budget travelers in the exciting Isla Verde resort area of San Juan, Puerto Rico. Just a few minutes by taxi from San Juan's airport and a short ride to the cruise ship piers, Coqui Inn is right across from Isla Verde Avenue which has resort hotels, restaurants, boutiques, 24-hour convenience stores, nightlife, casinos and Isla Verde's world-famous beach. Everything you need is just a few blocks away.
